Squats.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back with an overhand grip. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your chest up and back straight, until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Focus on engaging your core and maintaining proper alignment to target the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes effectively.

Lunges.Description: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle, ensuring the front knee is directly above the ankle. Push through the heel of the front foot to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

Deadlifts.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell over mid-foot, and grip it with hands just outside knees. Keep your back straight, engage your core, and lift the barbell by extending hips and knees simultaneously, keeping it close to your body. Focus on maintaining a neutral spine and engaging glutes, hamstrings, and lower back throughout the movement.

Bulgarian Split Squats.Description:
Stand with one foot elevated on a bench behind you and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Lower your body by bending the front knee until the thigh is parallel to the ground, keeping your chest upright and core engaged, then push through the front heel to return to the starting position. Focus on maintaining balance and control to effectively target the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings. 

Description

Romanian Deadlifts.Description: Begin with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip in front of your thighs. Keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent, hinge at the hips to lower the barbell along your legs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, then return to the starting position by driving your hips forward. Focus on engaging the hamstrings and glutes throughout the movement.

Step-Ups.Description: Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand, arms at your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Step one foot onto a sturdy bench or platform, pressing through the heel to lift your body up, bringing the opposite knee up to a 90-degree angle. Lower back down with control, alternating legs, focusing on engaging the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

Box Jumps.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, facing the plyo box. Bend your knees slightly, swing your arms, and explosively jump onto the box, landing softly with knees slightly bent. Step back down carefully to starting position, focusing on engaging your core and leg muscles throughout.

Calf Raises.Description: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Slowly raise your heels off the ground, balancing on the balls of your feet, and then lower back down with control. Focus on engaging your calf muscles throughout the movement.

Goblet Squats.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up and core engaged. Return to the starting position by driving through your heels, focusing on your quadriceps, glutes, and core.

Glute Bridge.Description: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell on your hips. Engage your core and glutes, then lift your hips towards the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, squeezing your glutes at the top. Lower back down with control, ensuring your feet remain flat and your knees stay aligned with your hips.

Reverse Lunges.Description: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step one foot back into a lunge, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle, ensuring the front knee stays aligned over the ankle. Push through the heel of the front foot to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging the glutes and quadriceps.

Sumo Deadlifts.Description: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out, holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended. Lower the dumbbells by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up, until the dumbbells are just above the floor. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging your glutes and inner thighs.
Sumo Deadlifts.Muscles: Glutes, Inner Thighs, Hamstrings, Lower Back

Single-Leg Romanian Deadlifts.Description: Stand upright holding a barbell with both hands, feet hip-width apart. Shift your weight onto one leg, hinge at the hips, and lower the barbell towards the ground while extending the opposite leg straight back, keeping your back flat and core engaged. Return to the starting position by driving through the heel of the standing leg, focusing on the hamstrings and glutes.

Pistol Squats.Description: Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms at your sides. Extend one leg forward and lower your body into a squat on the opposite leg, keeping your chest up and core engaged. Push through the heel of the standing leg to return to the starting position, focusing on balance and control throughout the movement.

Curtsy Lunges.Description: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step your right leg behind and across your left leg, bending both knees to lower your body into a lunge, ensuring your front knee aligns over your ankle. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position, and repeat on the opposite side, focusing on engaging your glutes and inner thighs.

Walking Lunges.Description: Begin standing with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step forward with your right foot, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle, ensuring your front knee is directly above your ankle. Push through your right heel to return to standing and repeat with the left leg, maintaining an upright torso throughout.

Jump Squats.Description:
Start in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart, lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, then explosively jump up, extending your arms overhead. Land softly back into the squat position, ensuring your knees are aligned with your toes and your core is engaged throughout the movement. Focus on maintaining a controlled descent and a powerful jump to effectively target the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and calves. 

Description

Side Lunges.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step your right foot out to the side, bending your right knee while keeping your left leg straight, and lower the dumbbells towards the floor. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position, then repeat on the left side, focusing on engaging your glutes and inner thighs.

Single-Leg Squats.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back. Lift one leg off the ground and squat down on the standing leg, keeping your chest up and core engaged, then return to the starting position. Focus on maintaining balance and control to target the quadriceps, glutes, and core.

Donkey Kicks.Description: Begin on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips, wearing ankle weights. Keeping your knee bent at 90 degrees, lift one leg towards the ceiling, engaging your glutes and core, then lower it back without touching the ground. Focus on controlled movements to maximize glute activation and maintain a neutral spine throughout.

Fire Hydrants.Description: Begin on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips, wearing ankle weights. Keeping your knee bent at 90 degrees, lift one leg out to the side until your thigh is parallel to the ground, then lower it back down without touching the floor. Focus on engaging your glutes and core throughout the movement to maintain stability.

Hip Thrusts.Description: Begin seated on the ground with your upper back resting against a bench, feet flat on the floor, and a barbell positioned over your hips. Drive through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, squeezing your glutes at the top. Ensure your chin is tucked and core engaged throughout the movement to target the glutes effectively.

Kettlebell Swings.Description: Begin with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of you. Hinge at the hips, slightly bending your knees, and swing the kettlebell back between your legs, then thrust your hips forward to swing it up to shoulder height, keeping your arms straight. Focus on engaging your core and glutes, ensuring the power comes from your hips, not your arms.

Cossack Squats.Description: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Shift your weight to one leg, bending the knee and lowering your hips while keeping the other leg straight, then return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side. Focus on engaging the glutes, quads, and inner thighs while maintaining an upright torso.

Plie Squats.Description: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing outwards, and hold a dumbbell with both hands in front of your chest. Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up and core engaged, until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Press through your heels to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging your inner thighs and glutes.

Bear Crawls.Description: Begin in a tabletop position with hands under shoulders and knees under hips, hovering slightly above the ground. Move forward by simultaneously stepping your right hand and left foot, then your left hand and right foot, keeping your back flat and core engaged. Focus on maintaining a steady pace and controlled movements to engage the shoulders, core, and legs effectively.

Russian Twists.Description: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding a medicine ball with both hands. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight, and lift your feet off the ground. Rotate your torso to the right, bringing the medicine ball beside your hip, then twist to the left, engaging your core throughout the movement.

Mountain Climbers.Description: Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Quickly drive your knees alternately towards your chest, maintaining a brisk pace while keeping your core engaged and hips level. Focus on maintaining proper form to target the core, shoulders, and legs effectively.

Plank Leg Lifts.Description: Begin in a standard plank position with your forearms on the ground and body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core and glutes, then lift one leg off the ground, keeping it straight and in line with your body, hold briefly, and lower it back down before switching legs. Focus on maintaining a stable core and avoiding any hip rotation throughout the movement.

Jump Lunges.Description: Begin in a standing position with feet hip-width apart, then step forward into a lunge, ensuring your front knee is aligned over your ankle. Explosively jump, switching legs mid-air, and land softly in a lunge with the opposite leg forward, maintaining a straight torso throughout. Focus on engaging your quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes for stability and power.

Wall Sits.Description: Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and about two feet away from the wall. Slide down the wall until your knees are at a 90-degree angle, keeping your back flat against the wall and your core engaged. Hold this position, ensuring your knees do not extend past your toes, to target the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

Side Plank Leg Raises.Description: Begin in a side plank position with your elbow directly under your shoulder and your body in a straight line. Engage your core and lift your top leg as high as possible while keeping your hips elevated and stable, then lower it back down with control. Focus on maintaining balance and engaging your obliques and glutes throughout the movement.

Walking Plank.Description:
Begin in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to heels. Lower one forearm to the ground, followed by the other, transitioning into a forearm plank, then return to the high plank position by placing one hand back on the ground at a time. Focus on keeping your core engaged and hips stable throughout the movement to effectively target the core, shoulders, and triceps. 

Description

Skater Lunges.Description: Begin in a standing position with feet hip-width apart. Leap laterally to the right, landing on your right foot while sweeping your left leg behind you, bending your right knee into a lunge. Push off your right foot to leap to the left, repeating the motion on the opposite side, focusing on balance and engaging your glutes, quads, and core.

Frog Jumps.Description: Begin in a squat position with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out, and hands touching the ground in front of you. Explosively jump forward, extending your legs and swinging your arms back, landing softly back into the squat position. Focus on engaging your quadriceps, glutes, and calves throughout the movement.

Scissor Kicks.Description: Lie on your back with your hands under your glutes for support, legs extended. Lift both legs off the ground slightly, then alternate crossing one leg over the other in a scissor-like motion, keeping your core engaged and lower back pressed into the floor. Focus on controlled movements to target the lower abs and hip flexors.

High Knees.Description:
Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, engage your core, and lift one knee towards your chest while simultaneously swinging the opposite arm forward. Quickly alternate legs, maintaining a brisk pace, ensuring your knees reach at least hip height to effectively engage the core and lower body muscles. Focus on maintaining an upright posture and landing softly on the balls of your feet to reduce impact. 

Description

Butt Kicks.Description: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, then jog in place while kicking your heels up towards your glutes. Keep your core engaged and maintain a brisk pace, focusing on a light landing to minimize impact. This exercise primarily targets the hamstrings and glutes.

Squat Jumps.Description: Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out, and hands at your sides. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up, then explosively jump upwards, extending your arms overhead. Land softly back into the squat position, ensuring your knees are aligned with your toes to engage the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes effectively.

Reverse Hyperextensions.Description: Lie face down on a bench with your hips at the edge, gripping the bench for support. Keeping your legs straight, lift them until they are in line with your torso, squeezing your glutes and lower back, then slowly lower them back down. Focus on controlled movements to engage the glutes, hamstrings, and lower back effectively.

Leg Presses.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up, then push through your heels to return to standing. Focus on engaging your quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes throughout the movement.

Leg Curls.Description: Lie face down on a bench with a dumbbell secured between your feet, ensuring your knees are just off the edge. Keeping your hips pressed into the bench, curl the dumbbell towards your glutes by bending your knees, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Focus on engaging your hamstrings throughout the movement.

Hamstring Curls.Description: Lie face down on a bench with a dumbbell secured between your feet, ensuring your legs are fully extended. Slowly curl the dumbbell towards your glutes by bending your knees, keeping your hips pressed against the bench, then lower back to the starting position. Focus on engaging your hamstrings throughout the movement, avoiding any swinging or jerking motions.

Front Squats.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing inward. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your chest up and core engaged, until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Focus on maintaining an upright torso and even weight distribution.

Zercher Squats.Description: Begin by positioning the barbell in the crook of your elbows, standing with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your chest upright and core engaged, until your thighs are parallel to the ground. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, focusing on maintaining a straight back throughout the movement.

Hack Squats.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up, until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging your quadriceps and glutes throughout the movement.

Split Squats.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Step one foot forward into a lunge position, ensuring the front knee aligns over the ankle and the back knee hovers just above the ground. Push through the front heel to return to standing, focusing on engaging the quadriceps and glutes.

Sissy Squats.Description: Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keeping your torso straight, lean back slightly as you bend your knees, lowering your body while keeping your heels elevated and knees forward. Focus on engaging your quadriceps and maintaining balance throughout the movement.

Good Mornings.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back with a firm grip. Keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent, hinge at the hips to lower your torso until it's nearly parallel to the floor, then return to the starting position. Focus on engaging your hamstrings, glutes, and lower back throughout the movement.

Hip Abductions.Description: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Lift one leg out to the side, keeping it straight and maintaining a slight bend in the standing leg, then return to the starting position. Focus on engaging the outer thighs and glutes while keeping your core stable.

Hip Adductions.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Shift your weight onto one leg and slowly lift the opposite leg across your body, keeping it straight, then return to the starting position. Focus on controlled movements to engage the inner thigh muscles effectively.

Leg Extensions.Description: Sit on a sturdy chair with your back straight and feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell between your feet. Slowly extend your legs until they are parallel to the floor, keeping your core engaged, then lower them back to the starting position. Focus on contracting your quadriceps throughout the movement for optimal results.

Walking Squats.Description: Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up and core engaged. While maintaining the squat position, take small steps forward, ensuring knees stay aligned with toes and weight is distributed evenly across your feet.

Lateral Lunges.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, then take a wide step to the side, bending the knee of the stepping leg while keeping the other leg straight. Lower your hips back and down, ensuring your knee stays aligned with your toes, then push back to the starting position. Focus on engaging your glutes, quads, and inner thighs throughout the movement.

Single-Leg Deadlifts.Description: Stand upright holding a barbell with both hands, feet hip-width apart. Shift your weight onto one leg, hinge at the hips, and lower the barbell towards the ground while extending the opposite leg straight behind you, keeping your back flat. Return to the starting position by engaging your glutes and hamstrings, ensuring your core remains tight throughout the movement.

Incline Lunges.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Step forward onto an incline with one foot, bending both knees to lower your body until the front thigh is parallel to the ground, ensuring the knee does not extend past the toes. Push through the front heel to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

Seated Calf Raises.Description: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell on each knee. Lift your heels by pressing through the balls of your feet, raising your knees and the dumbbells, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the calf muscles throughout the movement.

Jumping Lunges.Description: Begin in a standing position with feet hip-width apart, then step forward into a lunge, ensuring the front knee is aligned over the ankle. Explosively jump, switching legs mid-air, and land softly in a lunge with the opposite leg forward, maintaining a straight torso and engaged core throughout. Focus on balance and control to effectively target the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

Lateral Band Walks.Description: Begin by placing a resistance band around your legs, just above your knees. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and core engaged. Step laterally to the side, maintaining tension in the band, and then bring the other foot to meet it. Focus on keeping your hips level and knees aligned over your toes throughout the movement.

Glute Kickbacks.Description: Begin on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and knees under your hips, wearing ankle weights. Keeping your knee bent at 90 degrees, lift one leg up and back until your thigh is parallel to the ground, squeezing your glutes at the top. Lower the leg back to the starting position without touching the ground and repeat, focusing on engaging the glutes throughout the movement.

Toe Taps.Description: Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent at a 90-degree angle and your shins parallel to the floor. Engage your core, and slowly lower one foot to tap the ground, then return to the starting position and repeat with the other foot, maintaining a controlled movement throughout. Focus on keeping your lower back pressed into the floor to effectively engage the abdominal muscles.

Side Leg Raises.Description: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, wearing ankle weights. Shift your weight onto one leg and slowly lift the opposite leg to the side, keeping it straight and toes pointed forward. Focus on engaging the outer thigh and hip muscles, then lower the leg back to the starting position with control.
Side Leg Raises.Muscles: Gluteus medius, hip abductors, outer thighs

Wall Sit Leg Extensions.Description: Stand with your back against a wall and slide down into a squat position with thighs parallel to the ground. Extend one leg straight out in front of you, hold for a moment, then return to the starting position and switch legs. Focus on maintaining a strong core and keeping your back flat against the wall throughout the exercise.

Reverse Lunges with Twist.Description: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height. Step one foot back into a lunge, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about 90 degrees, then twist your torso towards the front leg, engaging your core. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side, ensuring your front knee stays aligned with your ankle.

Side Plank Leg Lifts.Description: Begin in a side plank position with your elbow directly under your shoulder and your body in a straight line. Engage your core and lift your top leg as high as possible while keeping your hips elevated and stable. Focus on maintaining balance and control throughout the movement to target the obliques, glutes, and abductors.

Single-Leg Hip Thrusts.Description:
Begin seated on the ground with your upper back against a bench, one foot flat on the floor, and the other leg extended. Place a barbell across your hips, then drive through the heel of the grounded foot to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, focusing on engaging the glutes and hamstrings. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat, ensuring the barbell remains stable throughout the movement. 

Description

Side Lying Leg Lifts.Description: Lie on your side with legs extended and stacked, supporting your head with your lower arm. Lift the top leg upwards while keeping it straight, then lower it back down with control, focusing on engaging the outer thigh and hip muscles. Ensure your core remains tight and your body aligned throughout the movement.

Single-Leg Squat Jumps.Description: Begin by standing on one leg with a barbell resting across your upper back, ensuring your core is engaged and your chest is lifted. Lower into a squat on the standing leg, then explosively jump upwards, landing softly back into the squat position. Focus on maintaining balance and control throughout the movement to effectively target the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and calves.

Single-Leg Glute Bridge.Description: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, holding a barbell across your hips. Extend one leg straight out, keeping the other foot planted, and lift your hips by squeezing your glutes until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees. Focus on engaging the glutes and hamstrings, ensuring the barbell remains stable throughout the movement.

Side Plank Hip Abductions.Description: Begin in a side plank position with your elbow directly under your shoulder and your feet stacked. Engage your core and lift your top leg upwards while keeping your body in a straight line, then lower it back down with control. Focus on maintaining stability and balance throughout the movement to effectively target the obliques and hip abductors.

Single-Leg Calf Raises.Description: Stand upright with a barbell resting across your upper back, feet hip-width apart. Shift your weight onto one foot, lifting the other slightly off the ground, and raise your heel as high as possible, engaging your calf muscle. Lower your heel back down with control, ensuring your knee remains slightly bent to avoid locking.

Dumbbell bench press.Description: Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest. Lower the dumbbells to the sides of your chest, keeping elbows at a 45-degree angle, then press them back up to the starting position. Focus on engaging your chest, shoulders, and triceps throughout the movement.

Overhead press.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, and hold it at chest level with palms facing forward. Press the barbell overhead by extending your arms fully, keeping your core engaged and back straight, then lower it back to the starting position. Focus on maintaining a controlled movement to target the shoulders, triceps, and upper chest effectively.

Tricep dips.Description: Begin by sitting on the edge of the parallette bars with your hands gripping the bars beside your hips, fingers pointing forward. Slide off the bars, lowering your body by bending your elbows to a 90-degree angle, keeping your back close to the bars, then push through your palms to return to the starting position. Focus on engaging your triceps throughout the movement, ensuring your shoulders remain down and away from your ears.

Push-ups.Description: Begin in a high plank position with your hands placed shoulder-width apart and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position, keeping your core engaged throughout. Focus on maintaining a straight back and avoid letting your hips sag or rise.

Lateral raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor, keeping your wrists straight and shoulders down. Focus on engaging the deltoids throughout the movement, then slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.

Skull crushers.Description: Lie on a flat bench with your feet firmly on the ground, holding a barbell with an overhand grip, arms extended above your chest. Keeping your elbows stationary, lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on engaging your triceps throughout the movement. Ensure controlled motion to avoid injury and maintain proper form.

Chest flyes.Description: Begin by lying on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest with a slight bend in the elbows. Slowly lower the weights out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest, then bring them back to the starting position by squeezing your chest muscles. Focus on maintaining control throughout the movement to effectively target the pectoral muscles.

Arnold press.Description: Begin seated or standing with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body at shoulder height. As you press the weights overhead, rotate your palms outward until they face forward at the top of the movement, then reverse the motion back to the start. Focus on controlled movements to engage the shoulders, triceps, and upper chest effectively.

Close-grip bench press.Description: Lie flat on a bench with feet firmly on the ground, grip the barbell with hands shoulder-width apart, and lift it off the rack. Lower the barbell slowly to your chest, keeping elbows close to your body, then press it back up to the starting position. Focus on engaging the triceps and chest throughout the movement.

Front raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your thighs. Keeping your arms straight, raise the dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height, then slowly lower them back down. Focus on controlled movements to engage the shoulders and avoid swinging.

Tricep kickbacks.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend slightly at the knees and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight. With elbows bent at 90 degrees and close to your sides, extend your arms backward until fully straightened, focusing on contracting the triceps. Return to the starting position with control.

Incline bench press.Description:
Lie back on an incline bench set at a 30-45 degree angle, with feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, lower it to your upper chest while keeping elbows at a 45-degree angle, then press it back up until arms are fully extended. Focus on engaging the upper chest, shoulders, and triceps throughout the movement. 

Description

Military press.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip. Press the barbell overhead by extending your arms fully, keeping your core engaged and back straight, then lower it back to the starting position. Focus on maintaining a stable stance and controlled movement to effectively target the shoulders and triceps.

Diamond push-ups.Description: Begin in a plank position with your hands close together, forming a diamond shape with your thumbs and index fingers directly under your chest. Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides, until your chest nearly touches your hands, then push back up to the starting position. Focus on engaging your triceps, chest, and core throughout the movement.

Reverse flyes.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, and hinge forward at the hips with a slight bend in the knees. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then slowly return to the starting position. Focus on engaging the rear deltoids and upper back muscles throughout the movement.

Tricep extensions.Description: Begin by standing or sitting with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended overhead, and palms facing each other. Keeping your elbows close to your head, lower the dumbbells behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the triceps throughout the movement to ensure proper form and effectiveness.

Decline push-ups.Description: Begin in a plank position with your feet elevated on a stable surface, such as a bench or step, and hands placed shoulder-width apart on the ground. Lower your chest towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line, then push back up to the starting position. Focus on engaging your chest, shoulders, and triceps throughout the movement.

Shoulder press.Description: Begin seated or standing with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended overhead, then slowly lower them back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the shoulders and maintaining a straight back throughout the movement.

Tricep pushdowns.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the resistance band handles with palms facing down. Anchor the band above you, keeping elbows close to your sides, and extend your arms downward until fully straightened, focusing on squeezing the triceps. Return to the starting position with control, ensuring elbows remain stationary throughout the movement.

Pike push-ups.Description: Begin in a downward dog position with your hands and feet on the ground, hips raised, and body forming an inverted V-shape. Lower your head towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body, then push back up to the starting position. Focus on engaging your shoulders, triceps, and upper chest throughout the movement.

Chest press machine.Description: Sit on the chest press machine with your back firmly against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, and press it upward until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower it back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the chest, triceps, and shoulders throughout the movement.

Dumbbell shoulder press.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position. Focus on engaging your shoulders and maintaining a stable core throughout the movement.

Tricep rope pushdowns.Description: Begin by securing the resistance band at a high anchor point. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, grasp the band handles with palms facing down, and elbows close to your sides. Push the handles down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully extended, focusing on contracting the triceps, then slowly return to the starting position.

Bench dips.Description: Begin by sitting on the edge of the parallette bars with your hands gripping the bars beside your hips, fingers pointing forward. Slide off the bars, extending your legs forward, and lower your body by bending your elbows to a 90-degree angle, keeping your back close to the bars. Push through your palms to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging your triceps throughout the movement.

Incline dumbbell press.Description: Begin seated on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position, focusing on engaging the chest, shoulders, and triceps throughout the movement. Ensure your back remains flat against the bench and avoid locking your elbows at the top.

Shoulder lateral raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor, then slowly lower them back down. Focus on engaging the deltoids throughout the movement, avoiding any swinging or using momentum.

Tricep overhead extension.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell with both hands, arms extended overhead. Keep your elbows close to your head as you lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the triceps throughout the movement.

Decline bench press.Description: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower the barbell to your lower chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle, then press it back up until your arms are fully extended. Focus on engaging your lower pectorals, triceps, and anterior deltoids throughout the movement.

Dumbbell front raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing down. Keeping your arms straight but not locked, raise the dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height, then slowly lower them back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the shoulders and maintaining a controlled movement throughout.

Tricep bench dips.Description:
Sit on the edge of a bench with your hands placed shoulder-width apart, fingers pointing forward, and legs extended with heels on the ground. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor, then push through your palms to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging the triceps throughout the movement. Ensure your back stays close to the bench to avoid shoulder strain. 

Description

Chest press.Description: Begin seated on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, feet flat on the floor. Lie back, holding the dumbbells at chest level with palms facing forward. Press the weights upward until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position, focusing on engaging the chest muscles throughout the movement.

Seated military press.Description: Sit upright on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position, focusing on engaging your shoulders and maintaining a stable core throughout the movement.

Tricep skull crushers.Description: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest. Keeping your elbows stationary, lower the dumbbells towards your forehead by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the triceps throughout the movement.

Incline push press.Description: Begin seated on an incline bench with your back supported, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position, focusing on engaging your chest, shoulders, and triceps throughout the movement. Ensure your core is tight to maintain stability and prevent arching of the lower back.

Shoulder shrugs.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keep your arms straight and lift your shoulders towards your ears, squeezing at the top, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the trapezius muscles throughout the movement.

Tricep V pushdowns.Description: Begin by securing the resistance band at a high anchor point and stand facing it, holding the ends with palms facing down. Start with elbows bent at 90 degrees and tucked close to your sides, then extend your arms downward in a V-shape until fully straight, focusing on engaging the triceps. Ensure to keep your core tight and avoid using momentum for a controlled movement.

Reverse grip bench press.Description:
Lie flat on a bench with feet firmly on the ground, grasp the barbell with an underhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width. Lower the barbell to your chest while keeping elbows close to your body, then press it back up to the starting position, focusing on engaging the triceps and upper chest. Ensure wrists are straight and controlled throughout the movement to prevent strain. 

Description

Dumbbell lateral raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor, then slowly lower them back down. Focus on engaging your shoulder muscles throughout the movement.

Tricep dumbbell kickbacks.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend slightly at the knees and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight. With elbows bent at 90 degrees and close to your sides, extend your arms backward until fully straightened, focusing on contracting the triceps. Return to the starting position with control.

Decline push press.Description: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position, focusing on engaging your chest, shoulders, and triceps throughout the movement. Ensure your back remains flat against the bench and avoid locking your elbows at the top of the press.

Dumbbell chest flyes.Description: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest with a slight bend in the elbows. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest, then bring them back to the starting position by squeezing your chest muscles. Focus on maintaining control throughout the movement to effectively target the pectoral muscles.

Shoulder front raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your thighs. Keeping your arms straight but not locked, raise the dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height, then slowly lower them back down. Focus on controlled movements to engage the anterior deltoids effectively.
Shoulder front raises.Muscles: Anterior deltoids, trapezius, and serratus anterior

Tricep bar pushdowns.Description: Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the resistance band handles with an overhand grip. Anchor the band above you, then extend your arms downward, keeping elbows close to your body, until your arms are fully extended, focusing on contracting the triceps. Return to the starting position with control, ensuring elbows remain stationary throughout the movement.

Dumbbell pullovers.Description: Lie on a flat bench with your upper back and shoulders supported, feet flat on the floor, and hold a dumbbell with both hands above your chest. Keeping your arms slightly bent, lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head until you feel a stretch in your chest, then return to the starting position by engaging your chest and lats. Focus on maintaining a stable core and controlled movement throughout the exercise.

Seated shoulder press.Description: Sit upright on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position. Focus on keeping your core engaged and avoid arching your back to effectively target the shoulders.

Tricep cable pushdowns.Description: Begin by securing the resistance band at a high anchor point and stand facing it, holding the band with both hands, palms facing down. Keep your elbows close to your sides and extend your arms downward until fully straightened, focusing on squeezing the triceps at the bottom of the movement. Return to the starting position with control, ensuring your elbows remain stationary throughout the exercise.

Chest squeeze press.Description: Begin seated or standing with a dumbbell in each hand, elbows bent at 90 degrees, and palms facing each other at chest level. Press the dumbbells together, squeezing your chest muscles, and extend your arms forward until they are fully extended. Return to the starting position, maintaining the squeeze throughout the movement to effectively engage the chest muscles.

Dumbbell arnold press.Description: Begin seated or standing with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body at shoulder height. As you press the weights overhead, rotate your palms outward until they face forward at the top of the movement, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position. Focus on controlled movements to engage the shoulders, triceps, and upper chest effectively.

Shoulder rear delt raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Bend slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight, and raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on squeezing the shoulder blades together. Lower the weights back to the starting position with control, ensuring the movement is slow and deliberate to target the rear deltoids effectively.

Tricep plate extensions.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight plate with both hands overhead, arms fully extended. Keeping elbows close to your head, lower the plate behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the triceps throughout the movement, ensuring controlled motion to avoid swinging.

Incline dumbbell flyes.Description: Begin by lying on an incline bench set at a 30-45 degree angle, holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, then bring them back to the starting position by squeezing your chest muscles. Focus on controlled movements to engage the pectoral muscles effectively.

Shoulder upright rows.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your body. Lift the dumbbells vertically, keeping them close to your torso, until elbows are at shoulder height, then lower them back down. Focus on engaging the shoulders and upper back while maintaining a straight posture throughout the movement.

Tricep single-arm kickbacks.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand, and hinge forward at the hips with a slight bend in the knees. Keep your back straight and elbow close to your body, extend your arm backward until fully straightened, then return to the starting position. Focus on engaging the triceps throughout the movement.

Dumbbell chest press.Description: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest, palms facing forward. Lower the dumbbells slowly to the sides of your chest, keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle, then press them back up to the starting position, focusing on engaging your chest muscles. Ensure your feet are flat on the floor and your back remains in contact with the bench throughout the movement.

Seated shoulder lateral raises.Description: Sit upright on a bench with feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, keeping your shoulders down and back. Focus on engaging the deltoids throughout the movement, then slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.

Tricep dips with dumbbells.Description: Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping dumbbells placed on either side of your hips, palms facing down. Slide your hips off the bench, keeping your legs extended and feet flat on the floor, then lower your body by bending your elbows to a 90-degree angle, ensuring your elbows point directly behind you. Push through your palms to return to the starting position, focusing on engaging the triceps throughout the movement.

Decline dumbbell press.Description: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with arms fully extended. Lower the dumbbells slowly to the sides of your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle, then press them back up to the starting position, focusing on engaging your chest muscles. Ensure your back remains flat on the bench and avoid locking your elbows at the top.

Dumbbell shoulder front raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your thighs. Keeping your core engaged and arms straight, lift the dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height, then slowly lower them back down. Focus on controlled movements to target the anterior deltoids effectively.
Dumbbell shoulder front raises.Muscles: Anterior deltoids, trapezius, and serratus anterior

Tricep bench dips with dumbbells.Description: Sit on the edge of a bench with your hands gripping the dumbbells placed on the bench beside your hips, fingers facing forward. Slide your hips off the bench, keeping your legs extended and feet flat on the floor, then lower your body by bending your elbows to a 90-degree angle, ensuring your elbows point straight back, and press back up to the starting position. Focus on engaging the triceps throughout the movement, avoiding any shoulder strain by keeping your shoulders down and away from your ears.

Chest pullovers.Description: Lie on a flat bench with your upper back and shoulders supported, feet flat on the floor, and hold a dumbbell with both hands above your chest. Keeping your arms slightly bent, lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head until you feel a stretch in your chest, then return to the starting position by engaging your chest and lats. Focus on controlled movement to target the chest, lats, and triceps effectively.

Seated shoulder front raises.Description: Sit upright on a bench with feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing down. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, raise the dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height, then slowly lower them back to the starting position. Focus on controlled movements to target the anterior deltoids effectively.
Seated shoulder front raises.Muscles: Anterior deltoids, trapezius, and serratus anterior

Tricep overhead extensions with dumbbell.Description: Begin by standing or sitting with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell with both hands, arms fully extended overhead. Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms close to your ears, then extend your arms back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the triceps throughout the movement.

Incline dumbbell chest press.Description: Begin seated on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position, focusing on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement. Ensure your feet are flat on the ground and your back remains in contact with the bench to maintain proper form.

Shoulder plate raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight plate in each hand with arms extended down in front of you. Keeping your core engaged and back straight, raise the plates to shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows, then lower them back down with control. Focus on engaging the shoulders and upper back throughout the movement.

Tricep kickbacks with resistance bands.Description: Begin by standing with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the resistance band handles with palms facing inward. Bend slightly at the knees and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight. With elbows tucked close to your sides, extend your arms straight back, squeezing the triceps at the top, then return to the starting position.

Dumbbell chest flyes on bench.Description: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest with a slight bend in the elbows. Slowly lower the dumbbells in an arc to the sides until you feel a stretch in your chest, then bring them back to the starting position by squeezing your chest muscles. Focus on controlled movements to engage the pectoral muscles effectively.

Seated shoulder rear delt raises.Description: Sit on the edge of a bench with feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Lean slightly forward at the hips, keeping your back straight, and raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on squeezing the shoulder blades together. Ensure controlled movements to target the rear deltoids effectively.

Tricep rope pushdowns with resistance ba.Description: Begin by anchoring the resistance band at a high point, then stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the band with both hands. Keep elbows close to your sides and extend your arms downward until fully straightened, focusing on contracting the triceps. Return to the starting position with control, ensuring elbows remain stationary throughout the movement.

Chest cable flyes.Description:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the resistance bands in each hand, anchored behind you at chest height. Begin with arms extended out to the sides, slightly bent at the elbows, and bring your hands together in front of your chest in a controlled motion, squeezing your chest muscles. Focus on maintaining a slight bend in the elbows throughout the movement to engage the pectoral muscles effectively. 

Description

Dumbbell shoulder lateral raises.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor, keeping your wrists in line with your shoulders. Focus on engaging your deltoids and avoid swinging or using momentum to lift the weights.

Shoulder dumbbell shrugs.Description: Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keeping your arms straight, elevate your shoulders towards your ears, squeezing at the top, then slowly lower them back down. Focus on engaging the trapezius muscles throughout the movement.

Tricep overhead extensions with resistan.Description: Begin by standing with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the resistance band with both hands, and raising your arms overhead. Keep your elbows close to your head as you extend your arms upward, fully straightening them to engage the triceps, then slowly return to the starting position. Focus on maintaining a stable core and controlled movements to effectively target the triceps without straining the shoulders.

Incline dumbbell press on bench.Description: Begin by lying back on an incline bench set at a 30-45 degree angle, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then slowly lower them back to the starting position, focusing on engaging your chest and shoulders throughout the movement. Ensure your feet are flat on the ground and your back remains in contact with the bench to maintain stability and proper form.

Chest dumbbell squeeze press.Description: Begin by lying on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other, and arms extended above your chest. Squeeze the dumbbells together as you lower them to your chest, keeping elbows close to your body, then press back up while maintaining the squeeze. Focus on engaging the chest muscles throughout the movement for maximum contraction.

Seated shoulder upright rows.Description: Sit on a bench with feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your body. Keeping your back straight, lift the dumbbells vertically towards your chin, leading with your elbows and keeping them higher than your wrists, then lower them back to the starting position. Focus on engaging your shoulders and upper back throughout the movement.

Tricep V pushdowns with resistance bands.Description: Begin by securing the resistance band at a high anchor point. Stand facing the anchor, grasp the band with both hands, and position your elbows close to your sides. Push the band downwards in a V shape until your arms are fully extended, focusing on engaging the triceps throughout the movement.

Dumbbell pullovers on bench.Description: Lie on a flat bench with your upper back and shoulders supported, feet flat on the floor, and hold a dumbbell with both hands above your chest. Keeping your arms slightly bent, lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head until you feel a stretch in your chest, then return to the starting position by engaging your chest and lats. Focus on maintaining a stable core and controlled movement throughout the exercise.

Shoulder dumbbell arnold press.Description: Begin seated or standing with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body at shoulder height. As you press the weights overhead, rotate your palms outward until they face forward at the top of the movement, then reverse the motion back to the start. Focus on controlled movement to engage the shoulders, triceps, and upper chest effectively.

Tricep cable pushdowns with resistance b.Description: Begin by securing the resistance band at a high anchor point. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, grasp the band with both hands, and position your elbows close to your sides. Push the band down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straightened, focusing on engaging the triceps, then return to the starting position with control.

Chest dumbbell chest press.Description: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest, palms facing forward. Lower the dumbbells slowly to the sides of your chest, keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle, then press them back up to the starting position. Focus on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement, ensuring a controlled motion without locking your elbows at the top.

Seated shoulder plate raises.Description: Sit upright on a bench with feet flat on the floor, holding a weight plate in each hand with arms extended down in front of you. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, raise the plates forward to shoulder height, then slowly lower them back to the starting position. Focus on controlled movements to target the shoulders and upper chest.

Tricep plate extensions with resistance.Description: Begin by standing with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the resistance band with both hands overhead, and elbows close to your ears. Slowly lower your forearms behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on engaging your triceps throughout the movement. Ensure your core is tight and back straight to maintain proper form.

Pull-up.Description: To perform a pull-up using a barbell, securely place the barbell on a rack at an appropriate height, grip it with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width, and hang with arms fully extended. Engage your core and pull your chest towards the barbell by retracting your shoulder blades and bending your elbows, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Focus on maintaining a controlled movement to effectively target the upper back and biceps.

Bent-over row.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged. Pull the dumbbells towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then lower them back to the starting position.

Chin-up.Description: Begin by gripping the pull-up bar with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart, and arms fully extended. Engage your core and pull your body upward until your chin is above the bar, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower yourself back to the starting position with control, ensuring full arm extension.

Single-arm dumbbell row.Description: Begin by placing your left knee and hand on a bench, keeping your back flat and parallel to the ground. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand, arm extended straight down, then pull the dumbbell towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body, and squeeze your shoulder blade at the top. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control, focusing on engaging your back muscles throughout the movement.

Barbell deadlift.Description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes under the barbell, and grip the bar just outside your knees. Keep your back straight, chest up, and shoulders back as you lift the bar by extending your hips and knees, then lower it back to the ground with control. Focus on engaging your glutes, hamstrings, and lower back throughout the movement.

Seated row.Description: Sit on the bench with feet flat on the platform, knees slightly bent, and grasp the cable handle with both hands. Pull the handle towards your torso, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body, then slowly extend your arms back to the starting position. Focus on engaging your back muscles throughout the movement.

Face pull.Description: Begin by anchoring the resistance band at upper chest height. Stand facing the anchor point, holding the band with both hands, palms facing down. Pull the band towards your face, keeping elbows high and squeezing the shoulder blades together, focusing on the rear deltoids and upper back. Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.

Hammer curl.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your torso. Keeping your elbows close to your body, curl the weights up by bending your elbows, ensuring your wrists remain neutral and your upper arms stationary. Focus on squeezing the biceps at the top of the movement before slowly lowering the weights back to the starting position.

Wide grip lat pulldown.Description: Sit at the cable machine with your thighs secured under the pad and grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows pointed down and back, then slowly return to the starting position. Focus on engaging your latissimus dorsi throughout the movement.

Reverse flyes.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, and hinge forward at the hips with a slight bend in the knees. With a slight bend in the elbows, raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the rear deltoids and upper back muscles throughout the movement.

Underhand barbell row.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up. Bend slightly at the knees and hinge at the hips, keeping your back straight, and pull the barbell towards your lower ribcage, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Focus on engaging the lats and biceps while maintaining a stable core throughout the movement.

Kettlebell swing.Description: Begin with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of you. Hinge at the hips, keeping your back straight, and swing the kettlebell between your legs, then drive your hips forward to swing it up to shoulder height. Focus on engaging your core and glutes throughout the movement.

T-bar row.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hinge at the hips while keeping your back straight. Grasp the barbell with both hands, palms facing down, and pull it towards your chest by squeezing your shoulder blades together, then slowly lower it back down. Focus on engaging the upper back, lats, and biceps throughout the movement.

Inverted row.Description: Begin by lying under the parallette bars with your body straight, arms extended, and heels on the ground. Pull your chest towards the bars by engaging your back and biceps, keeping your elbows close to your body, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Focus on maintaining a straight line from head to heels throughout the movement.

Alternating renegade row.Description: Begin in a high plank position with a dumbbell in each hand, wrists directly under shoulders, and feet slightly wider than hip-width apart for stability. Keeping your core engaged and hips level, row one dumbbell towards your ribcage by bending the elbow, then lower it back to the ground and repeat on the opposite side. Focus on maintaining a straight line from head to heels and avoid rotating your torso.

Pull-up with knee raise.Description: Begin by hanging from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart, and arms fully extended. Pull your body upward until your chin is above the bar while simultaneously raising your knees toward your chest, engaging your core. Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner, focusing on your back, biceps, and abdominal muscles.

Single-arm kettlebell row.Description: Begin in a staggered stance with one foot forward, holding a kettlebell in the opposite hand. Bend slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight, and pull the kettlebell towards your hip, engaging your back muscles, then lower it back down with control. Focus on keeping your core tight and avoid twisting your torso.

Barbell shrugs.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip in front of your thighs. Keep your arms straight and lift your shoulders towards your ears, squeezing at the top, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the trapezius muscles throughout the movement.

Lying T-bar row.Description: Lie face down on an incline bench, holding a barbell with an overhand grip. Pull the barbell towards your chest by squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body, then slowly lower it back to the starting position. Focus on engaging the upper back and lat muscles throughout the movement.

Dumbbell pullover.Description: Lie on a flat bench with your upper back and shoulders supported, feet flat on the floor, and hold a dumbbell with both hands above your chest. Keeping your arms slightly bent, lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head until you feel a stretch in your chest, then return to the starting position by engaging your chest and lats. Focus on maintaining a stable core and controlled movement throughout the exercise.

Resistance band pull-aparts.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a resistance band with both hands at shoulder height, arms extended in front of you. Pull the band apart by moving your hands outward, keeping your arms straight, until the band touches your chest, then slowly return to the starting position. Focus on engaging the upper back and shoulder muscles throughout the movement.

L-sit pull-up.Description: Begin by hanging from the pull-up bar with an overhand grip, arms fully extended, and legs straight out in front of you to form an "L" shape. Engage your core and pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar, keeping your legs parallel to the ground throughout the movement. Focus on maintaining a controlled motion to effectively target the upper back, biceps, and core muscles.

Iso-lateral row.Description: Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Grasp the handles with a neutral grip, keeping your back straight and shoulders down. Pull the handles towards your torso by squeezing your shoulder blades together, then slowly return to the starting position, focusing on engaging your back muscles throughout the movement.

Kettlebell high pull.Description: Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell with both hands in front of you. Engage your core, hinge at the hips, and pull the kettlebell upwards towards your chin, keeping elbows higher than wrists, then lower it back down with control. Focus on maintaining a straight back and using your hips and shoulders to drive the movement.

Barbell curl.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand grip, arms fully extended. Curl the barbell towards your chest by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body, and focus on contracting your biceps. Lower the barbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner, ensuring your back remains straight throughout the movement.

Dumbbell renegade row.Description: Begin in a high plank position with a dumbbell in each hand, wrists aligned under shoulders, and feet hip-width apart for stability. Keeping your core engaged and hips level, row one dumbbell towards your ribcage by bending your elbow, then lower it back to the ground and repeat on the other side. Focus on maintaining a stable torso to effectively target the back, shoulders, and core muscles.

Band face pull.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the resistance band at shoulder height with both hands, palms facing down. Anchor the band at eye level, pull it towards your face by retracting your shoulder blades, keeping elbows high and wide, then slowly return to the starting position. Focus on engaging the rear deltoids and upper back muscles.

Incline dumbbell row.Description: Begin by lying face down on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended towards the floor. Pull the dumbbells towards your hips by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, then slowly lower them back to the starting position. Focus on engaging your upper back and lats throughout the movement.

Barbell reverse curl.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width. Keeping elbows close to your body, curl the barbell upwards by flexing your elbows, focusing on the forearms, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Ensure controlled movements to maximize forearm engagement and avoid swinging.

Kettlebell bent-over row.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand. Bend at the hips, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent, then pull the kettlebells towards your waist, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Focus on engaging your back and core muscles throughout the movement.

Barbell upright row.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly closer than shoulder-width. Pull the barbell vertically towards your chin, keeping elbows higher than wrists, and maintain a straight back throughout the movement. Focus on engaging the shoulders and upper back muscles.

Dumbbell hammer curl.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your torso. Keep your elbows close to your body and curl the weights up by bending your elbows, maintaining the neutral grip throughout the movement. Focus on keeping your upper arms stationary and squeeze your biceps at the top before slowly lowering the weights back to the starting position.

Resistance band row.Description: Begin seated with legs extended, securing the resistance band around your feet. Hold the band handles with arms extended, palms facing each other. Pull the handles towards your torso, keeping elbows close to your body, and squeeze your shoulder blades together. Focus on engaging your back muscles throughout the movement.

Mixed grip chin-up.Description: Begin by gripping the pull-up bar with one palm facing towards you and the other facing away, hands shoulder-width apart. Engage your core and pull your body upward until your chin is above the bar, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Focus on maintaining a controlled movement to effectively target the biceps, lats, and upper back.

Single-arm cable row.Description: Stand facing the cable machine with feet shoulder-width apart, grasp the handle with one hand, and slightly bend your knees. Pull the handle towards your torso by retracting your shoulder blade and bending your elbow, keeping your back straight and core engaged. Focus on squeezing your back muscles at the end of the movement before slowly returning to the starting position.

Kettlebell snatch.Description: Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell between your legs with one hand. Drive through your hips to swing the kettlebell upward, keeping it close to your body, and punch your hand through at the top to lock out overhead. Focus on explosive hip extension and shoulder stabilization.

Barbell bent-over row.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip. Bend at the hips and knees slightly, keeping your back straight and parallel to the floor. Pull the barbell towards your lower ribcage, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then lower it back down with control.

Dumbbell concentration curl.Description: Sit on a bench with your legs spread, holding a dumbbell in one hand. Rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh, keeping your upper arm stationary, and curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder, focusing on contracting the bicep. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control, ensuring full range of motion.

Resistance band curl.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a resistance band under your feet and gripping the handles with palms facing forward. Keep elbows close to your sides and curl the band upwards by bending your elbows, focusing on contracting your biceps. Slowly lower back to the starting position, ensuring controlled movement throughout.

Single-arm lat pulldown.Description: Sit at the cable machine with your feet flat on the floor and grasp the handle with one hand, palm facing forward. Pull the handle down towards your chest while keeping your torso upright and your elbow close to your body, then slowly return to the starting position. Focus on engaging your latissimus dorsi throughout the movement.

Kettlebell renegade row.Description: Begin in a high plank position with a kettlebell in each hand, ensuring your body forms a straight line from head to heels. Row one kettlebell towards your hip while stabilizing your core and keeping your hips level, then lower it back to the ground and repeat on the other side. Focus on engaging your core, back, and shoulders throughout the movement.

Barbell Zottman curl.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand grip. Curl the barbell upward, rotating your wrists to an overhand grip at the top, then lower it slowly, maintaining control. Focus on engaging the biceps and forearms throughout the movement.

Dumbbell spider curl.Description: Begin by lying face down on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms fully extended towards the floor. Curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary, and focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement before slowly lowering back to the starting position.

Resistance band face pull.Description: Begin by anchoring the resistance band at upper chest height and stand facing it, holding the band with both hands, palms facing down. Pull the band towards your face, keeping elbows high and squeezing shoulder blades together, focusing on the rear deltoids and upper back. Ensure to maintain a neutral spine and avoid shrugging shoulders during the movement.

Single-arm resistance band row.Description: Begin by securing the resistance band at a low anchor point, then stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the band in one hand with your arm extended. Pull the band towards your torso by bending your elbow and squeezing your shoulder blade back, keeping your core engaged and torso stable. Focus on maintaining a controlled movement to effectively target the back muscles.

Kettlebell single-arm snatch.Description: Begin with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand between your legs. Explosively drive through your hips and pull the kettlebell upward, keeping it close to your body, then punch your hand through to lock out the kettlebell overhead. Focus on maintaining a straight wrist and a tight core throughout the movement.

Barbell Pendlay row.Description: Begin with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell on the floor. Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back flat and parallel to the ground, and grip the barbell with an overhand grip. Pull the barbell towards your lower chest, engaging your back muscles, then lower it back to the floor with control.

Dumbbell incline row.Description: Sit on an incline bench with your chest supported and feet firmly on the ground, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip. Pull the dumbbells towards your hips by squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping your elbows close to your body, then slowly lower them back to the starting position. Focus on engaging your upper back and lats throughout the movement.

Resistance band hammer curl.Description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a resistance band under your feet with palms facing each other. Keep elbows close to your sides and curl the bands upward by bending your elbows, focusing on contracting the biceps and forearms. Lower slowly to starting position, ensuring controlled movement throughout.

Kettlebell bottoms-up press.Description: Begin by standing with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand with the bottom facing up at shoulder height. Press the kettlebell overhead by extending your arm fully, keeping your wrist straight and core engaged to maintain balance. Focus on controlled movement to stabilize the shoulder and engage the deltoids, triceps, and core.
